refsect1.title: Introduction
refsect1.para: Acropolis is the software stack that powers the Research & Education Space platform. You can read more about how the platform works in our book, Inside Acropolis.

The Research & Education Space is a platform being jointly delivered by Jisc, the British Universities Film & Video Council (BUFVC), and the BBC with the aim of bringing as much as possible of the UKâ€™s publicly-held archives, and more besides, to learners and teachers across the UK.

The stack consists of a number of different projects, including utility libraries and daemons. Each can be checked out and built individually (as would typically be the case in a real deployment), or the whole stack can be built together, which can be useful in development.

refsect1.title: Getting Acropolis
refsect1.para: The bbcarchdev/acropolis Github repository hosts the Acropolis meta-project (it is a project which exists primarily to make it easier to build the various sub-projects together).
You can download the repository, and all of the linked sub-projects, using git:
